abstracts.cdata!:
These environmental guidelines form the
            basis for recommendations on the environmental assessment,
            for the implementation of the Second Poverty Alleviation
            Project. Based on a review of the environmental policy, and
            regulations in Tajikistan, and of the Bank's policy
            guidelines, the report offers environmental monitoring at
            the construction, and operation stages, through the
            following mitigation measures checklists. Soil degradation,
            and water contamination due to spills, and sewer leakage
            should be prevented by protecting soil surfaces, either with
            covers, or by spraying, as well as by re-vegetation
            practices, and, by conducting appropriate waste disposal
            services, including adequate disposal of oil spills, and
            hazardous materials. Regarding natural habitat degradation,
            and vegetation losses, alternative project sites should be
            considered if possible; otherwise, both compensation, and
            biodiversity conservation measures should be taken into
            account. Social environmental issues, such as wastes
            disposal (including medical wastes) conducive to potential
            waterborne diseases, noise disturbances, and traffic
            disruption, should follow strict environmental regulations,
            i.e., waste management control, and waste treatment,
            sanitary epidemiological testing, restricted construction
            working schedules, traffic safety measures, and community participation.
